item.title: 通胀率接近蒂努布的年底目标，尼日利亚将下调利率
item.description: 尼日利亚中央银行准备延长其宽松周期，因为通胀率低于预期，使其更接近政府的年终目标。【原文：The Central Bank of Nigeria is poised to extend its easing cycle after softer-than-expected inflation brought it closer to the government’s year-end target.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利称未来数月日元将因美国降息而升值 10
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）策略师表示，在美国经济放缓迹象日益明显的情况下，如果美联储连续降息，日元兑美元汇率在未来几个月内将升值近 10%。【原文：The yen looks set to appreciate nearly 10% against the dollar in the coming months if the Federal Reserve delivers back-to-back rate cuts amid growing signs of a US economic slowdown, Morgan Stanley strategists said.】

item.title: Grab 支持的超级银行在雅加达首次公开募股中最多募集 1.86 亿美元
item.description: 印尼超级银行（PT Super Bank Indonesia）隶属于印尼企业集团PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi，正计划在雅加达进行首次公开募股，募集资金可达3.1万亿印尼盾（1.86亿美元）。【原文：PT Super Bank Indonesia, part of Indonesian conglomerate PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi, is planning an initial public offering in Jakarta that could raise as much as 3.1 trillion rupiah ($186 million).】

item.title: 台湾对特朗普在习近平通话稿中未提及钓鱼岛感到高兴
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统在与中国领导人习近平通话后决定不公开提及钓鱼岛，台湾对此表示欢迎，称这对台北来说是 "最好的结果"。【原文：Taiwan welcomed President Donald Trump’s decision not to publicly reference the island after his call with Chinese leader Xi Jinping, describing it as the “best result” for Taipei.】

item.title: 马来西亚星巴克运营商遭抵制后业务反弹
item.description: 星巴克在马来西亚的经营者表示，在加沙冲突引发的抵制活动导致门店关闭和严重亏损之后，星巴克的业务正在逐步恢复。【原文：The operator of Starbucks in Malaysia says business is gradually recovering after the Gaza conflict-triggered boycotts led to store closures and steep losses.】

item.title: 私募股权公司 Gaw 在最后一刻获得贷款延期
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，私募股权公司高伟绅资本（Gaw Capital Partners）在经过最后一刻的谈判后，获得了本周一到期的房地产抵押贷款的延期，这凸显了中国房地产危机的持久影响。【原文：Private equity firm Gaw Capital Partners secured an extension to a property-backed loan that was due Monday, people familiar with the matter said, after last-minute talks highlighting the enduring impact of China’s property crisis.】

item.title: Kpler 数据显示中国液化天然气进口量将连续第 13 个月下降
item.description: 由于中国国内产量和管道天然气进口保持强劲，11月份运往中国的液化天然气海运量将连续第13个月环比下降，从而延续购买量下滑的趋势。【原文：Seaborne shipments of liquefied natural gas to China in November are set to drop for a 13th straight month on an annual basis, extending a slump in purchases as domestic output and piped imports remain strong.】

item.title: 供应紧张，美联储降息预期升温，铜价上涨
item.description: 由于近期供应紧张以及对美国联邦储备委员会下月再次降息的预期升温，铜价走高。【原文：Copper edged higher on near-term supply tightness and rising expectations the US Federal Reserve will cut interest rates again next month.】

item.title: 全球科技支出复苏，印度软件股重回焦点
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 尽管受到监管限制，高频企业在印度的利润仍大幅增长
item.description: 尽管受到监管部门的限制，高频交易公司在印度仍实现了强劲的利润增长，显示出它们在印度 5.4 万亿美元股票市场上挖掘机会的灵活性。【原文：High-frequency trading firms have posted strong profit growth in India despite regulatory curbs, showcasing their agility in tapping opportunities across the country’s $5.4 trillion equity market.】

item.title: 据说东京燃气计划以 1.91 亿美元出售银座大厦
item.description: 据知情人士透露，东京燃气公司计划以超过 300 亿日元（1.91 亿美元）的价格将东京银座的一栋商业大楼出售给 Mantomi 资产管理公司。【原文：Tokyo Gas Co. plans to sell a commercial building in Ginza, Tokyo to Mantomi Asset Management for over ¥30 billion ($191 million), according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 日本高市称特朗普向她通报了与中国习近平通话的情况
item.description: 日本首相高市真奈表示，应美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的要求，她与特朗普进行了通话，特朗普向她介绍了他与中国国家主席习近平通电话的情况以及中美关系的最新状况。【原文：Japan’s Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi said she spoke with US President Donald Trump at his request, and that he briefed her on his phone call with Chinese President Xi Jinping and the latest state of US-China relations.】

item.title: 美国军舰引发恐慌后，委内瑞拉向雪佛龙公司购买原料
item.description: 一艘美国军舰在委内瑞拉海岸附近阻挡了一艘俄罗斯船只的去路，威胁到急需原料的供应，委内瑞拉正在向雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp.【原文：Venezuela is tapping Chevron Corp. for supplies of a key feedstock after a US warship blocked the path of a Russian vessel near the country’s coast, threatening to roil deliveries of the much-needed material.】

item.title: 阿达尼巨型铜冶炼厂陷入全球矿石短缺困境
item.description: 印度大亨高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）斥资 12 亿美元在古吉拉特邦兴建的铜冶炼厂，由于全球供应紧缩，目前只收到了年产量 50 万吨的工厂满负荷运转所需的一小部分矿石。【原文：Indian tycoon Gautam Adani’s $1.2 billion copper smelter in Gujarat is receiving only a fraction of the ore required to operate the 500,000-ton-a-year plant at full capacity, as a global supply squeeze tightens.】

item.title: 据说贝恩资本将在相干区块交易中寻求 11.4 亿美元的投资
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，贝恩资本（Bain Capital）出价 11.4 亿美元收购了相干公司（Coherent Corp.【原文：Bain Capital offered a block of Coherent Corp. shares for as much as $1.14 billion, according to people familiar with the matter, as the private equity firm continues to sell down its stake in the laser equipment maker.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行叶曼表示，澳大利亚央行可能会在 2026 年重新考虑加息问题
item.description: 澳大利亚联邦银行（Commonwealth Bank of Australia）首席经济学家卢克-耶曼（Luke Yeaman）表示，如果物价压力依然顽强，劳动力市场进一步收紧，澳大利亚央行明年可能会转向加息。【原文：Australia’s central bank may shift to raising interest rates next year if price pressures remain stubbornly strong and the labor market tightens further, said Luke Yeaman, chief economist at Commonwealth Bank of Australia.】

item.title: 中国的人工智能承诺吸引亚洲顶级基金远离韩国和台湾
item.description: 一位表现出色的亚洲基金经理正在增持中国的人工智能股票，同时从韩国和台湾的人工智能股票中撤出，理由是估值和前景相对较好。【原文：A top-performing Asian money manager is boosting exposure to artificial-intelligence stocks in China while retreating from those in South Korea and Taiwan, citing relatively better valuations and outlook.】

item.title: 加拿大广播公司称，加拿大同意为新石油管道铺平道路的协议
item.description: 据加拿大广播公司（Canadian Broadcasting Corp）周一报道，加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）和阿尔伯塔省省长丹尼尔-史密斯（Danielle Smith）已就一项协议的主要条款达成一致，该协议将支持一条新的石油管道通往加拿大西海岸。【原文：Prime Minister Mark Carney and Alberta Premier Danielle Smith have agreed to the broad terms of a deal that would support a new oil pipeline to Canada’s west coast, the Canadian Broadcasting Corp. reported Monday.】

item.title: Alphabet 因报告称 Meta 将使用其人工智能芯片而上涨；Nvidia 下跌
item.description: 谷歌所有者 Alphabet 公司在《信息》报道 Meta Platforms 公司正在洽谈斥资数十亿美元购买这家搜索巨头的人工智能芯片后，在尾盘交易中最多上涨了 2.7%。【原文：Google owner Alphabet Inc. gained as much as 2.7% in late trading after the Information reported that Meta Platforms Inc. is in talks to spend billions of dollars on the search giant’s artificial intelligence chips.】

item.title: 美联储理事讲话引发对美国降息的押注，黄金走势平稳
item.description: 由于对美国下月降息的信心增强，黄金在上一交易日大涨后企稳。【原文：Gold steadied, after surging in the previous session due to increased confidence that the US will cut interest rates next month.】

item.title: 亚洲大亨以私人信贷基金支持 15 亿美元的人工智能赌注
item.description: 亚洲最大的金融企业之一的元老正与全球其他富豪一起加强人工智能投资，以消除对泡沫的担忧。【原文：A patriarch for one of Asia’s biggest finance fortunes is joining other members of the global rich in bolstering artificial intelligence investments, defying fears of a bubble.】

item.title: 交易商关注风险情绪和乌克兰谈判，石油价格保持稳定
item.description: 投资者追随更广泛金融市场的风险情绪，抵消了乌克兰问题和平谈判取得进展可能为增加原油供应铺平道路所带来的影响，因此石油价格保持稳定。【原文：Oil steadied as investors tracked a risk-on mood in wider financial markets, which countered the impact of progress in peace talks over Ukraine that could pave the way for increased crude supplies.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴吸引内地买家，人工智能热潮和云计算推动前景看好
item.description: 中国大陆投资者在阿里巴巴集团第二财季财报发布前增持阿里巴巴，押注其人工智能工具 "Qwen "的强势推出将有助于推动未来增长。【原文：Mainland Chinese investors are increasing their stakes in Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. ahead of fiscal second-quarter earnings, betting that the strong launch of its AI tool Qwen will help fuel future growth.】

item.title: 增长强劲，韩国消费者信心跃升至 8 年高点
item.description: 与美国达成的贸易协议缓解了出口前景的不确定性，加上夏季经济增长强于预期，韩国消费者信心在 11 月份攀升至八年来的最高点。【原文：South Korea’s consumer confidence climbed to an eight-year high in November, supported by a trade agreement with the US that eased uncertainty over export prospects and by stronger-than-expected growth over the summer.】

item.title: 伯利为他对 Nvidia 的批评辩护，Nvidia 公司予以反击
item.description: 迈克尔-伯利（Michael Burry）坚持他对英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）的批评，即使有报道称这家领先的人工智能公司回击了他的分析。【原文：Michael Burry is standing by his criticism of Nvidia Corp. even after a report said the leading artificial intelligence company pushed back on his analysis.】

item.title: 花旗印度资产支持证券账面价值接近 10 亿美元
item.description: 在过去两年里，花旗集团印度分部的资产支持证券账面价值翻了一番多，达到近 10 亿美元，提前实现了今年 2 月为自己设定的目标。【原文：Citigroup Inc.’s India unit has more than doubled its asset-backed securities book to nearly $1 billion in the last two years, ahead of schedule for a goal it set for itself in February.】

item.title: 私募股权投资公司 PAG 在中国大举反向押注
item.description: 没有人会指责私募股权巨头 PAG 随波逐流。【原文：No one could accuse private equity giant PAG of following the crowd.】

item.title: 亚洲股市将追随华尔街科技股反弹：市场综述
item.description: 亚洲股市有望追随华尔街的涨势，因为科技股引领反弹，而且投资者对美联储可能在 12 月降息的信心增强。【原文：Asian stocks were poised to track Wall Street gains as technology shares led a rebound and investors grew more confident about a potential Federal Reserve rate cut in December.】

item.title: Thoma Bravo 的 Realpage 公司通过数据协议与司法部达成和解
item.description: Thoma Bravo LLC 旗下的 RealPage 公司与美国司法部就一起反托拉斯案件达成和解协议，该案指控 RealPage 公司垄断了租房软件市场，并在美国各地的住宅业主中助长了操纵价格的共谋行为。【原文：Thoma Bravo LLC’s RealPage Inc. and the Justice Department reached a settlement agreement in an antitrust case that had accused the company of monopolizing the market for rental property software and fostering a price-fixing conspiracy among residential landlords around the US.】

item.title: 加息促使日本地区银行为生存而合并
item.description: 三十年前，日本曾因一场坏账危机而被迫掀起兼并浪潮，从而造就了其超大型贷款机构，而现在的焦点则是美国 3 万亿美元地区银行业的整合。【原文：Three decades after a bad debt crisis in Japan forced a wave of mergers that created its mega lenders, the focus now is on consolidation in the nation’s $3 trillion regional banking industry.】
